metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16335 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
newoffsets handling in ChopUpSingleUncompressedStrip in tif_dirread.c inLibTIFF 4.0.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF file, as demonstrated bytiff2pdf. This is a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-15209.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16335` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.4').
